alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 8:43PM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Independence, Lawrence and Jackson Counties. Black River At Pocahontas affecting Randolph County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Pocahontas. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river east and south of Pocahontas will be impacted by high water. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning and continue rising to a crest of 18.0 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Black River Pocahontas 17.0 7.8 Thu 8 PM 15.6 17.8 18.0 18.0 12 PM 3/05 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
